article.title: Gordon Elliot - dead horse photo
article.text:
Elliott, 42, came under fire after the shocking pictures were shared on social media on Saturday, and he has apologised 'profoundly' and confirmed he was fully co-operating with an investigation.
www.dailymail.co.uk
Are people disgusted by this. Should he be banned from racing. He's lost the gig with Betfair already. Is that fair. Or disproportionate.
Click to expand...
From what I heard (but this was his own version to be fair) it sounded completely OTT to me. That said, I have a more general problem with the way racehorses are sent to a massacre at some races, steeple chasing in particular. Not sure how this particular incident is more than an illustration of how the horses are considered generally though. Like when you hear that X number of horses died at the Grand National this year - what is there in that that would lead anyone to expect a trainer to treat one of those dead horses sympathetically?
 
"Only the most narrow minded nationalist could write such bile"
